premises: If something exists it must have a purpose.
Only mechanisms can be explained logically.
Purpose cannot be explained logically without a Transcendent source.
Objective moral obligations create real moral debts.
Unresolved moral debts negate complete justice.
Human justice is contingent and limited.
Final_Court_Necessity.implication: Ultimate justice requires a non-contingent adjudicator.

Design_vs_Accident.statement: Complex functional systems imply intentional design and purpose.
Design_vs_Accident.necessity: Stable teleology cannot emerge from randomness.

Definition_of_Normal.statement: Normality is alignment with optimal human functioning.

Network_Effect.statement: All actions produce compounded systemic consequences.
Network_Effect.implication: Local benefit cannot justify global harm.
